intro: Myrcianthes spixiana, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It is often found in coastal and lowland regions, thriving in humid, warm climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes introduced outside its native range.
